Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Description

What We're Looking For:

We are looking for a passionate Data Scientist specializing in Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Machine Learning (ML) to contribute to Data Enrichment efforts within Meltwater. As a part of this role, you will work with experienced team members and product managers to design, test, and implement machine learning solutions.

Through Meltwater's innovative social listening platform, we ensure our clients never miss any mention of their brand or essential topics across various platforms, automating the entire social listening process.

Partner with us and be part of a diverse community that values your unique contributions, empowering you to reach new heights. Join us in crafting something extraordinary.

What You’ll Do:


Contribute to the development of scalable algorithms for processing large datasets, implement and evaluate machine learning and deep learning algorithms for tasks such as text classification, sentiment analysis, entity recognition, and summarization.
Assist in the design, development, and testing of ML models for real-time processing of unstructured data.
Collaborate with senior team members to analyze the impact of algorithm changes.
Learn and grow under mentorship, gaining exposure to industry-standard NLP tools and techniques.


What You’ll Bring:


Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or a related field, with 2-4 years working experience OR a Master’s Degree in Computer Science or a related field, with 0-2 years working experience.
Programming Language: Proficiency in Python.
Solid understanding of data structures and algorithms.
Proficient in Machine Learning, including understanding Neural Networks and foundational concepts of NLP tasks such as Tokenization, Named Entity Recognition (NER), Sentiment Analysis, Part-of-Speech (POS) Analysis.
Experience or coursework in Deep Learning frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Strong problem-solving skills and a curiosity for learning new technologies.
Good verbal and written communication skills.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., Azure (preferable), AWS, or Google Cloud).
Basic knowledge of containerization tools like Docker and orchestration platforms like Kubernetes.
Interest in infrastructure-as-code tools like Terraform.
Passion for exploring the intersection of NLP and emerging fields such as generative AI or multimodal systems.


What We Offer:


Enjoy 26 days of annual paid time off plus an additional day off on your birthday!
Enjoy national and global health coverage through our statutory health insurance, ensuring your well-being wherever you are
Benefit from a 30% employer contribution to our Company Pension scheme (BAV)
Enjoy an additional day off on your birthday, promoting a healthy work-life balance
Complimentary CalmApp subscription for you and your loved ones because mental wellness matters.
Energetic work environment with a hybrid work style, providing the balance you need
Benefit from our family leave program, which grows with your tenure at Meltwater.
Thrive within our inclusive community and seize ongoing professional development opportunities to elevate your career.


Where You'll Work: Brückenstraße 6, 10179 Berlin

Our Story

The sky is the limit at Meltwater.

At Meltwater, we believe that when you have the right people in the right working environment, great things happen. Our best-in-class technology empowers our 27,000 customers around the world to analyze over a billion pieces of data each day and make better business decisions.

Our award-winning culture is our north star and drives everything we do – from striving to create an environment where all employees do their best work, to delivering customer value by continuously innovating our products — and making sure to celebrate our successes and have fun along the way.

We’re proud of our diverse team of 2,300+ employees in 50 locations across 25 countries around the world. No matter where you are, you’ll work with people who care about your success and get the support you need to reach your goals.

So, in a nutshell, that's Meltwater. We love working here, and we think you will too.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

Meltwater is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: At Meltwater, we are dedicated to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace where every employee feels valued, respected, and empowered. We are committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity and strive to provide a work environment that is free from discrimination and harassment.

All employment decisions at Meltwater are made based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, marital status, veteran status, or any other status protected by the applicable laws and regulations.

Meltwater does not tolerate discrimination or harassment of any kind, and we actively promote a culture of respect, fairness, and inclusivity. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, experiences, and abilities to apply and join us in our mission to drive innovation and make a positive impact in the world.

Title: Data Scientist in Energy Tech Start Up - hybrid Berlin based (f/m/d)
Description:
Digitalization and energy transition in one sentence? That’s what we do at Green Fusion! Our software optimizes heating systems in the real estate sector, helping to combat climate change through digitalization and automation. We reduce emissions and energy consumption, actively advancing the energy transition.




As a Data Scientist, you’ll support our Energy Optimization Team by developing production-ready algorithms that optimize heating system operations. With a basic understanding of heating systems and strong expertise in control technology, you’ll bring essential insights to help us develop effective tools for energy optimization.


Tasks



Data Analysis: Clean and analyze data to identify patterns and trends, uncovering insights that drive our solutions.


Statistical Analysis: Use statistical techniques to interpret data, ensuring the reliability and accuracy of your findings.


Data Science: Create data models to predict heating system behavior and patterns using advanced analytics techniques and machine learning.


Algorithm Development: Create production-ready algorithms and data pipelines to optimize energy system components, reducing CO2 emissions and enhancing energy efficiency.


Collaboration: You will be responsible for the entire process of developing product features, from understanding customer requirements to final feature deployment. This requires seamless collaboration with energy engineers, frontend and backend developers, product and customer success managers.


Research Support: Conduct experimental data analysis to refine and improve energy optimization algorithms.


Clear Communication: Present findings in a concise and understandable manner.


Additional tasks: Support our team in creating data models to predict energy time series data (e.g. heat demand, solar production, electricity consumption) and in optimizing energy systems using machine learning algorithms ((Un)supervised and Reinforcement Learning).



Requirements



Location: You are living in Berlin.





Experience





At least three years of professional experience in data science. Familiar with product lifecycles (Feasibility studies, requirement engineering, production-ready tool development, code reviews, feature deployments, continuous maintenance and improvement).





Must haves





Strong skills in statistics, data modeling, data analysis and machine learning.


Educational background in: electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, physics or computer science, data science, mathematics with a strong background in energy tech.





Technical Knowledge





Expertise in developing prediction models and working with energy time series data.


Proficient in Python, SQL, GraphQL, REST, and data science libraries like Pandas, SciPy, and Scikit-Learn. Machine Learning Operations skills are a plus.


Hands-on experience with version control systems (Git) and collaborative coding practices.






Testing: Familiarity with testing frameworks and quality assurance practices to ensure robust and reliable product features.


Programming Style: Your code is clean, well-structured, maintainable, and easy to understand for team collaboration.


Communication: You are comfortable collaborating and communicating effectively with energy engineers, frontend and backend developers, and customer success managers.


Customer Focus: A strong understanding of customer needs and how they translate into technical solutions.


Language Skills: Fluent in English, with basic German.



Benefits


🏠 Flexible working hour models, home office, and remote work.




💡 Ongoing training opportunities – whether through job challenges, our open feedback culture, or sponsored training programs, there are always opportunities to learn and grow.




💼 Employee benefits such as Urban Sports Club or Become1.




🌱 Direct impact through your job – with us, you can actively contribute to the energy transition and fight against climate change every day.




💚 We value our team – that's why regular team events are very important to us.




🙌 The best team that Berlin has to offer – and maybe even beyond. Don’t believe it? Then find out for yourself and apply now!




---




While we are still considered pioneers today, we can soon dominate the market with you! First in the DACH region, then throughout Europe.




You can expect a motivated, open-minded, and dynamic environment that is passionate and ambitious about actively shaping the energy transition – a goal that can only be achieved together!




We look forward to your application – Fernanda will get in touch with you!

Show more

Title: ML Engineer - MedTech Startup
Description:
About Us:

Nucs AI is an innovative MedTech startup revolutionizing the management of prostate cancer through AI-powered solutions. We develop advanced medical software that leverages cutting-edge machine learning models to assist healthcare providers in diagnosing and treating prostate cancer. As we finalize our seed investment round, we are seeking a talented AI/ML Engineer to join our growing team and contribute to the development of our pioneering technology.

Why Join Us?

Impactful Work: Directly contribute to AI-driven solutions that improve patient outcomes and save lives.

Innovative Environment: Collaborate with a forward-thinking team using cutting-edge AI and machine learning technologies.

Professional Growth: Own key projects, expand your AI/ML expertise, and work on real-world healthcare applications.

Startup Culture: Join a dynamic, fast-paced work environment where your contributions make a tangible impact.

Position Overview:

As an ML Engineer at Nucs AI, you will be at the forefront of developing and deploying cutting-edge machine learning models to power our AI-driven medical software solutions. Your role will involve building algorithms that analyze medical images and data, driving innovation in prostate cancer diagnosis and treatment. You will work closely with our engineering teams to ensure that our AI models are scalable, secure, and aligned with clinical and regulatory standards.

Key Responsibilities:


Model Development: Design, train, and optimize machine learning models for medical image analysis, leveraging deep learning techniques (e.g., CNNs, Vision Transformers, Multi-Modal LLMs).
Data Processing: Build data pipelines to clean, preprocess, and augment large datasets of medical images, ensuring the highest accuracy of AI models.
Integration: Collaborate with back-end developers to integrate AI models into our software solutions for seamless deployment in clinical environments.
Cloud-Based AI: Develop scalable AI solutions on cloud platforms (Google Cloud preferred) using tools such as PyTorch, ONNX Runtime or similar.
Regulatory Compliance: Ensure AI models and data processing adhere to healthcare regulations like HIPAA and meet medical industry standards.
Evaluation Pipeline: Build strong evaluation pipelines to extract insights about trained model performance.



What We’re Looking For (must-haves):


Strong proficiency in machine learning frameworks: PyTorch and ONNX
Experience with medical imaging technologies and datasets: DICOM, NIFTY and similar
Expertise in developing deep learning models for 3D image segmentation.
Strong expertise in fine-tuning and deployment of multi-modal LLMs
Familiarity with cloud platforms (Google Cloud or AWS)



Previous experience with PACS integration is a strong plus.

What We Offer:


An exciting and dynamic work environment in the cutting-edge MedTech industry.
Opportunities to work closely with the leadership team and contribute to the development of innovative products.
Competitive salary and potential for growth within the company.
Stock options, providing an opportunity to own a part of our rapidly growing startup.
Flexible working hours and remote work options, along with regular communication and participation in team meetings.



How to Apply:

If you are passionate about AI/ML and excited about contributing to the future of healthcare technology, we want to hear from you! Please send your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience and explaining why you’re interested in this role.

Join Nucs AI and help transform the future of prostate cancer management with innovative, AI-powered solutions!


PyTorch & ONNX
Fine-tuning multi-modal LLMs
Google Cloud or AWS experience
3D Image Segmentation
Ability to work with data formats like DICOM and NIFTY
Located in Berlin

Title: Frontend Developer – Berlin
Description:
Frontend Developer - Global Fitness Movement – Berlin




(Tech stack: Front End Developer, JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3, Angular, KnockoutJS, BackboneJS, React, VueJS, jQuery Typescript, Web, UI, UX, User Interface, User Experience, Front End Developer)




Established in 2012 in California, our client embarked on developing an app and website that streamlined the process of finding and booking fitness classes for enthusiasts across the state. Today, the company is transforming how people lead their lives, fostering a community of fitness enthusiasts, helping individuals discover activities that bring their true selves to life, and supporting small businesses and studios globally. They firmly believe that an active lifestyle is the key to a happy and healthy life. Currently active in over 15 countries, our client is experiencing rapid annual growth.




Achieving greatness requires a collaborative effort, and this team boasts some of the most talented Front End Developers (JavaScript, jQuery, Angular) in the industry. Beyond being exceptional developers, they are also accomplished karaoke stars, community activists, and amateur chefs. Together, they are actively shaping a world that prioritizes physical activity, making each day incredibly fulfilling.




They are seeking a Front End Developer with experience in some or all of the following technologies (full training will be provided to fill any gaps in your skill set): JavaScript, LESS, SASS, ES6, HTML5, CSS3, Angular, KnockoutJS, BackboneJS, React, VueJS, jQuery, Typescript, and AJAX.




All positions come with the following benefits:

Annual bonus.
Free medical, dental, and vision coverage.
Flexible work hours.
€5,000 training allowance.
Healthy (and unhealthy) snacks.
Charitable giving programs.
Virtual team classes, events, and happy hours.




Success is a team effort, driven by collaboration with talented individuals and the development of innovative ideas. As part of a global movement with ambitious plans for the future, this is an incredible opportunity. If you're interested, take action and apply today!




Location: Berlin, Germany / Remote Working




Salary: €80,000 - €110,000 + Bonus + Pension + Benefits




NOIREURGENSP1

NOIRGERMANYREC

NOIREUROPEREC




NC/HT/BER8010

Title: Test Engineer (m/f/d) - Berlin, Germany
Description:
Dentsply Sirona is the world’s largest manufacturer of professional dental products and technologies, with a 130-year history of innovation and service to the dental industry and patients worldwide. Dentsply Sirona develops, manufactures, and markets a comprehensive solutions offering including dental and oral health products as well as other consumable medical devices under a strong portfolio of world class brands. Dentsply Sirona’s products provide innovative, high-quality and effective solutions to advance patient care and deliver better and safer dentistry. Dentsply Sirona’s global headquarters is located in Charlotte, North Carolina, USA. The company’s shares are listed in the United States on NASDAQ under the symbol XRAY.




Bringing out the best in people




As advanced as dentistry is today, we are dedicated to making it even better. Our people have a passion for innovation and are committed to applying it to improve dental care. We live and breathe high performance, working as one global team, bringing out the best in each other for the benefit of dental patients, and the professionals who serve them. If you want to grow and develop as a part of a team that is shaping an industry, then we’re looking for the best to join us.




Working at Dentsply Sirona you are able to:




Develop faster - with our commitment to the best professional development.




Perform better - as part of a high-performance, empowering culture.




Shape an industry - with a market leader that continues to drive innovation.




Make a difference -by helping improve oral health worldwide.







Test Engineer (m/f/d) - Berlin, Germany




We are looking for a qualified Software Test Manager (m/f/d) with experience or a strong interest in developing expertise in test automation. As a SureSmile Test Manager (m/f/d) you will be responsible for the end-to-end software verification process: from the analysis of new software requirements, defining test strategy, plan and execute software verification till the update of the SureSmile medical device documentation.




Your Responsibilities:







Assist the PO in analyzing and translating orthodontic software requirements into design specifications.
Lead the definition of test scenarios and test cases. Update and extend the test strategy when needed.
Extend and update the medical device product documentation to ensure full test coverage and traceability.
Perform integration, functional, system and regression testing.
Structure, design and perform automated tests. Identify new opportunities to streamline the test methodology.
Collaborate closely across the various departments: R&D, Supply Chain, Training, Customer Care, QA/RA.
Troubleshoot with incoming operational issues.
Identify, document, track defects till resolved and deployed.
Communicate solutions and fixes to other departments/customers.







Your Profile:




3+ years SW quality assurance/testing experience.
Experience in the orthodontic domain is advantageous.
Experience with working in the highly regulated medical device industry is advantageous.




Key Skills, Knowledge & Capabilities:

Experience with test management tools and processes (e.g. Matrix Req. X-Rays) .
Experience with bug/issues tracking tools (e.g. Jira) .
Experience in writing software tests, good understanding of software testing concepts (for example: TDD, BDD, testing pyramid)
Experience with the Java/Selenium and Postman API automated testing framework or other test frameworks is an advantage
Experience in SQL/database and scripting.
Great attestation to detail, critical thinking and analytical skills.
Strong commitment to deliver high-quality results
High motivation to learn and apply modern technology
Strong communications skills
Very good knowledge of English, both written and spoken. German advantageous.

Show more

Shape an industry - with a market leader that continues to drive innovation.


Make a difference -by helping improve oral health worldwide.



Test Engineer (m/f/d) - Berlin, Germany


We are looking for a qualified Software Test Manager (m/f/d) with experience or a strong interest in developing expertise in test automation. As a SureSmile Test Manager (m/f/d) you will be responsible for the end-to-end software verification process: from the analysis of new software requirements, defining test strategy, plan and execute software verification till the update of the SureSmile medical device documentation.


Your Responsibilities:



  • Assist the PO in analyzing and translating orthodontic software requirements into design specifications.
  • Lead the definition of test scenarios and test cases. Update and extend the test strategy when needed.
  • Extend and update the medical device product documentation to ensure full test coverage and traceability.
  • Perform integration, functional, system and regression testing.
  • Structure, design and perform automated tests. Identify new opportunities to streamline the test methodology.
  • Collaborate closely across the various departments: R&D, Supply Chain, Training, Customer Care, QA/RA.
  • Troubleshoot with incoming operational issues.
  • Identify, document, track defects till resolved and deployed.
  • Communicate solutions and fixes to other departments/customers.



Your Profile:


  • 3+ years SW quality assurance/testing experience.
  • Experience in the orthodontic domain is advantageous.
  • Experience with working in the highly regulated medical device industry is advantageous.


Key Skills, Knowledge & Capabilities:

  • Experience with test management tools and processes (e.g. Matrix Req. X-Rays) .
  • Experience with bug/issues tracking tools (e.g. Jira) .
  • Experience in writing software tests, good understanding of software testing concepts (for example: TDD, BDD, testing pyramid)
  • Experience with the Java/Selenium and Postman API automated testing framework or other test frameworks is an advantage
  • Experience in SQL/database and scripting.
  • Great attestation to detail, critical thinking and analytical skills.
  • Strong commitment to deliver high-quality results
  • High motivation to learn and apply modern technology
  • Strong communications skills
  • Very good knowledge of English, both written and spoken. German advantageous.

Title: Senior Data Scientist (m/f/d)
Description:
Company Description

Flink is the leading quick commerce player in Europe. We are on a mission to give people back time: You can order your groceries through our app and we deliver to your doorstep in minutes. We carry 3,000 products with a focus on the leading brands in each category. We aim for sustainability by making deliveries on electric bikes and utilizing recyclable packaging.

Flink launched in February 2021 and already operates in more than 90 cities in Germany, and the Netherlands. The business generated more than EUR 400m in revenues in 2022 and is operationally profitable. Flink is backed by the world’s most renowned tech investors, including Prosus, Mubadala, and Bond, and strategic investors like Doordash and REWE. We take great pride in being an inclusive employer that offers equal opportunities, and we celebrate the diversity and multiculturalism of our team. We're growing fast and always pushing ourselves to do better - we play for #1.

In your role as a Senior Data Scientist (m/f/d), you will get the chance to work in a cross-functional team and have a direct impact on the business by building state-of-the-art ML models. The problem space we work in relates to improving and optimizing last mile delivery operations. Forecasting demand, estimating delivery times, optimizing routes and delivery areas are examples of problems we work on.

You can expect to work on business-critical projects in close collaboration with various Flink stakeholders as well as with our Engineering teams. Get ready to be immersed in the fast-paced environment of quick commerce where data is a first-class citizen.

Job Description


Lead and mentor team members in developing advanced models that generate insightful predictions and enable the steering of day-to-day business decisions
Partner with internal stakeholders to identify the best ways to integrate our Data Science products in our quick grocery and workforce apps
Ensure and drive excellence within the Data Science team by ensuring projects follow best practices and proper monitoring of impact
Analyze data to evaluate the impact of our models and to identify opportunities for improvement


Qualifications


Bachelor's degree or higher in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field
At least 5 years of hands-on experience in applying diverse Data Science methodologies to solve real-world business problems in production environments using Python
Proficient in writing and reading SQL (experience with Google BigQuery is a plus)
Strong verbal and written communication skills in English


Bonus


Expertise in at least two of the following domains: last-mile delivery, logistics, optimization, time series analysis
Experience with tools and technologies such as Kubernetes, Airflow, and cloud infrastructure (e.g., GCP)
Familiarity with ML platforms like MLflow or Vertex AI
Experience deploying, running, and monitoring real-time machine learning models


Additional Information


A €1000 annual L&D budget as well as individual coaching options to ensure you have plenty of opportunities to learn, grow and achieve your goals
26 days of vacation, +1 day every year up to a maximum of 30 days
A mobility budget of 30 EUR per month with NAVIT, which you can use individually for Uber, BVG and many other providers
A cool discount on your Urban Sports Club membership
Attractive company pension options
Unlimited access to an e-learning and development platform, MyAcademy, including online German courses
Online discounts with Corporate Benefits and Future Bens
A cool discount off your personal Flink orders; be the first to test out new products!
A modern and dog-friendly office in the heart of Berlin - lots of delicious lunch spots available within short walking distance


It is our commitment that every applicant will be evaluated according to their skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Werde Data Scientist bei smedo

 

Über uns: Bei smedo sind wir auf einer Mission, die Welt der kontaktlosen Biometrie-Technologie zu revolutionieren. Stell dir vor, du misst Vitalzeichen wie Herzfrequenz, Herzvariabilität und Atemfrequenz, ohne die Person zu berühren oder zu sehen – genau das tun wir! Unsere Technologie ist so präzise und vielseitig, dass es fast wie Magie wirkt (aber es ist einfach wirklich gute Wissenschaft). Werde Teil unseres Teams und mach das Gesundheitswesen intelligenter, Herzschlag für Herzschlag.




Aufgaben:

Tauche in Datenmeere ein und fische die wertvollsten Erkenntnisse heraus.
Entwickle und implementiere Machine-Learning-Modelle, die unsere Technologie noch schlauer machen.
Arbeite mit brillanten Köpfen aus verschiedenen Abteilungen zusammen, um reale Probleme zu lösen.
Präsentiere deine Ergebnisse den Stakeholdern so, dass selbst deine Oma sie versteht.
Halte unsere Dateninfrastruktur am Laufen, als wäre sie eine gut geölte Maschine.




Anforderungen:

Nachgewiesene Erfahrung als Data Scientist (wir sprechen von echter Erfahrung, nicht nur einem schicken Titel).
Beherrschung statistischer Methoden und Datenanalyse (die Dinge, die dich wie einen Zauberer aussehen lassen).
Beherrschung von Python (weil wer liebt nicht eine gute Programmiersprache?).
Erfahrung mit Machine-Learning-Frameworks (Extrapunkte, wenn du unseren Modellen das Tanzen beibringen kannst).
Vertrautheit mit Radar ist von Vorteil (wir sprechen nicht vom Wetter).
Hervorragende Problemlösungsfähigkeiten und Detailgenauigkeit (denn der Teufel steckt im Detail).
Starke Kommunikations- und Teamfähigkeiten (wir sind eine freundliche Truppe, versprochen).
Professionelle Sprachkenntnisse in Deutsch und Englisch (damit du uns in zwei Sprachen beeindrucken kannst).




Was wir bieten:

Eine kollaborative und innovative Arbeitsumgebung (wo deine Ideen zählen).
Möglichkeiten zur beruflichen Weiterentwicklung (weil wir an dein Potenzial glauben).
Wettbewerbsfähiges Gehalts- und Leistungspaket (wir wissen, dass du es wert bist).




Bewerbung: Wenn du leidenschaftlich an Data Science interessiert bist und einen echten Unterschied machen möchtest, freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung! Nutze den Bewerbungsprozess von LinkedIn und lass uns gemeinsam Datenmagie erschaffen!




-----------------------------




Become a Data Scientist at smedo

 

About Us: At smedo, we are on a mission to revolutionize the world of contactless biometric technology. Imagine measuring vital signs like heart rate, heart variability, and respiration rate without even touching or seeing the person – that's what we do! Our tech is so precise and versatile, it feels like magic (but it's just really good science). Join us and be part of a team that's making healthcare smarter, one heartbeat at a time.

 

Responsibilities:

Dive into oceans of data and fish out the most valuable insights.
Craft and deploy machine learning models that make our tech even smarter.
Team up with brilliant minds across departments to solve real-world problems.
Present your findings to stakeholders in a way that even your grandma would understand.
Keep our data infrastructure running smoother than a well-oiled machine.

 

Requirements:

Proven experience as a Data Scientist (we're talking about real experience, not just a fancy title).
Mastery of statistical methods and data analysis (you know, the stuff that makes you look like a wizard).
Proficiency in Python (because who doesn't love a good programming language?).
Experience with machine learning frameworks (bonus points if you can teach our models to dance).
Familiarity with Radar is a plus (we're not talking about the weather kind).
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail (because the devil is in the data).
Strong communication and teamwork abilities (we're a friendly bunch, promise).
Proficiency in both German and English at a professional level (so you can impress us in two languages).

 

What We Offer:

A collaborative and innovative work environment (where your ideas matter).
Opportunities for professional growth and development (because we believe in your potential).
Competitive salary and benefits package (we know you're worth it).

 

How to Apply: If you're passionate about data science and ready to make a real impact, we want to hear from you! Apply now through LinkedIn application process and hear from us soon! 

Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Consumer, Payments
Description:
Job Description

About Consumer Analytics at Wolt

As the name Consumer Analytics implies, this team aims to provide reliable data insights that drive informed decision-making, empower Wolt's product organization, and foster a data-driven culture through collaboration and education, ultimately inspiring teams and building value for the Consumer group.

About The Payments Domain

Payment Group at Wolt is building a world-class payment infrastructure for the best customer experience. You’ll be part of the team working on a smooth, scalable, and secure checkout experience adapting to the many use cases of consumers.

About The Role

As a Data Scientist at Wolt, your role involves diving into our data to solve crucial business problems. The scope of this role ranges from diagnosing problem areas to identifying solutions to designing experiments and ultimately influencing decision-making. This is a rare, operational, and actionable data-driven experience. When you join this team, you will be driving action from the frontlines, rather than just doing yet another analytics role.

If you enjoy finding patterns amidst chaos, are excited to build from 0 to 1, and have experience using analytics to affect Payments, we're looking for someone like you!

Our offering to you


The online delivery platform that Wolt is building will offer you interesting and complex challenges together with the opportunities to create a big impact with your skills. Lots of geolocational and temporal data in real-time combined with differences in the economics and dynamics of the cities we operate in make Wolt both a challenging and so interesting company to practice analytics.
You can choose the location from our tech hubs Helsinki, Berlin and Stockholm, or you can work entirely remotely anywhere in Finland, Germany, Sweden and Estonia. You have the chance to decide the ways of working — a hybrid, at the office, or remote within the location above. 💙 Read more about our remote setup.
You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognize that if we don’t learn, we won’t stay still but fall behind and keep in mind that Luke was Yoda’s greatest achievement. Read more about how we work.


Our humble expectations


Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in a Data Analyst or Data Scientist position.
Experience with the Payments domain - we’ll pay lots of attention to this experience.
Expertise in statistical analysis, including hypothesis testing (A/B testing), and experimentation using statistical software packages in Python, R, or equivalent.
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets.
Have prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Tableau, Mixpanel, Looker, or similar.


Next Steps

The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!

The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.

For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Zhanna Filintseva (zhanna.filintseva@wolt.com)

About Wolt

Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to your home or office. Wolt is not just a delivery app – we’re a technology company building a commerce platform to seamlessly connect our millions of customers with thousands of merchant and courier partners, in real-time across 23 countries and 250+ cities. Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry’s highest ratings, largely thanks to our customer-first-mindset, which shows in how we build products and run operations. In June 2022 we officially joined forces with DoorDash. Combined, we have a presence in 27 countries, 23 of which operate with the Wolt brand and app. Wolt and DoorDash continue largely independently, with Wolt’s name, brand, product, technology and team.

Working in Product Development at Wolt

At Wolt, we’re about getting things done. You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people.

The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 400+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 40 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams. Teams are made up of a mix of talented individuals: engineers, designers, data scientists, analysts, and product leads. Each team takes ownership for solving customer problems in the best possible way.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.

Join us today to build Wolt together!

Title: Senior Data Scientist - Berlin
Description:
Vestiaire Collective is the leading global online marketplace for desirable pre-loved fashion. Our mission is to transform the fashion industry for a more sustainable future by empowering our community to promote the circular fashion movement. Vestiaire was founded in 2009 and is headquartered in Paris with offices in London, Berlin, New York, Singapore, Ho Chi Minh and Hong Kong and warehouses in Tourcoing (France), Crawley (UK), Hong Kong and New York.

We currently have a diverse global team of 700 employees representing more than 50 nationalities. Our values are Activism, Transparency, Dedication and Greatness and Collective. We are proud to be a BCorp.

Vestiaire Collective is looking for a Senior Applied Scientist (F/M/D) to join the Discovery Collective team in Berlin.

About The Role 🖥️
Based in Berlin, we are building a new team to face fashion search challenges. You will be part of a multicultural, innovative, versatile, supportive environment that takes work-life balance seriously. To have a data driven company is one of our priorities. The Search team is working on delivering high quality search results from 5M+ items, for 80+ markets in 8+ languages. You will work with other software engineers and applied scientists to build Vestiaire Collective’s fashion search & recommendation engine. You will work on hard and fun problems of fashion discovery where personalization matters.

What You will do 👜

Build full pipelines for models to solve use cases for fashion discovery (product recommendation, ranking, personalization…)

Collaborate with business and product and other engineers and applied scientists and deploy your solutions to production.

Ensure model maintenance, monitoring, and scalability are consistently addressed.

Propose and implement R&D POC projects if you identify possible enhancements to the business, and pitch them to the relevant teams.

You will be expected to take on a leadership role on your projects: you will make the appropriate technical choices (algorithms, data transformation, technologies to use), discuss scope & scheduling with collaborators outside the team, and incorporate feedback as needed

Who you are ⭐

Demonstrated ability to create and optimize end-to-end pipelines for machine learning models. You are very familiar with MLOps.

Strong experience in delivering Machine Learning projects which have created impact on production.

Technical knowledge in Deep Learning, Python, SQL, Machine learning & Statistics.

Broad interests in DS and adjacent topics: modelling, statistics, monitoring, data engineering, production.

Experience with cloud providers (AWS, GCP, Azure), Experience with AB testing

Fluent English (technical interviews will be conducted in English)Initiative, autonomous, communicating with technical and non technical people.

Our Technology Stack includes

Languages: Python, Golang

Application Framework: PyTorch, Airflow, FastAPI, Tensorflow, Torchserve

Data Storage: Snowflake, Redis, Elasticsearch

Others: AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, Github

More information about our stack : Vestiaire Tech Radar and ourTech Blog

** The role is hybrid, based in Berlin **

What we offer 🎁

A meaningful job with an impact on the way people consume fashion and promote sustainability

The opportunity to do career-defining work in a fast-growing French-born scale up

The possibility to work as part of a globally diverse team with more than 50 nationalities

Two days to help Project - reinforcing your activist journey and volunteer for an association

Significant investment in your learning and growth

Competitive compensation and benefits package (i.e 28 days of paid time off)

As full member of our entrepreneurial project, you will be eligible to free shares

Surveys show that women and members of underrepresented communities only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the required conditions. Does this sound like you? If so, Vestiaire Collective encourages you to reconsider your application. We look forward to receiving your application!

Vestiaire Collective is an equal opportunities employer
Show more
HTML:
Vestiaire Collective is the leading global online marketplace for desirable pre-loved fashion. Our mission is to transform the fashion industry for a more sustainable future by empowering our community to promote the circular fashion movement. Vestiaire was founded in 2009 and is headquartered in Paris with offices in London, Berlin, New York, Singapore, Ho Chi Minh and Hong Kong and warehouses in Tourcoing (France), Crawley (UK), Hong Kong and New York.

We currently have a diverse global team of 700 employees representing more than 50 nationalities. Our values are Activism, Transparency, Dedication and Greatness and Collective. We are proud to be a BCorp.

Vestiaire Collective is looking for a Senior Applied Scientist (F/M/D) to join the Discovery Collective team in Berlin.

About The Role 🖥️
Based in Berlin, we are building a new team to face fashion search challenges. You will be part of a multicultural, innovative, versatile, supportive environment that takes work-life balance seriously. To have a data driven company is one of our priorities. The Search team is working on delivering high quality search results from 5M+ items, for 80+ markets in 8+ languages. You will work with other software engineers and applied scientists to build Vestiaire Collective’s fashion search & recommendation engine. You will work on hard and fun problems of fashion discovery where personalization matters.

What You will do 👜

Build full pipelines for models to solve use cases for fashion discovery (product recommendation, ranking, personalization…)

Collaborate with business and product and other engineers and applied scientists and deploy your solutions to production.

Ensure model maintenance, monitoring, and scalability are consistently addressed.

Propose and implement R&D POC projects if you identify possible enhancements to the business, and pitch them to the relevant teams.

You will be expected to take on a leadership role on your projects: you will make the appropriate technical choices (algorithms, data transformation, technologies to use), discuss scope & scheduling with collaborators outside the team, and incorporate feedback as needed

Who you are ⭐

Demonstrated ability to create and optimize end-to-end pipelines for machine learning models. You are very familiar with MLOps.

Strong experience in delivering Machine Learning projects which have created impact on production.

Technical knowledge in Deep Learning, Python, SQL, Machine learning & Statistics.

Broad interests in DS and adjacent topics: modelling, statistics, monitoring, data engineering, production.

Experience with cloud providers (AWS, GCP, Azure), Experience with AB testing

Fluent English (technical interviews will be conducted in English)Initiative, autonomous, communicating with technical and non technical people.

Our Technology Stack includes

Languages: Python, Golang

Application Framework: PyTorch, Airflow, FastAPI, Tensorflow, Torchserve

Data Storage: Snowflake, Redis, Elasticsearch

Others: AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, Github

More information about our stack : Vestiaire Tech Radar and ourTech Blog

** The role is hybrid, based in Berlin **

What we offer 🎁

A meaningful job with an impact on the way people consume fashion and promote sustainability

The opportunity to do career-defining work in a fast-growing French-born scale up

The possibility to work as part of a globally diverse team with more than 50 nationalities

Two days to help Project - reinforcing your activist journey and volunteer for an association

Significant investment in your learning and growth

Competitive compensation and benefits package (i.e 28 days of paid time off)

As full member of our entrepreneurial project, you will be eligible to free shares

Surveys show that women and members of underrepresented communities only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the required conditions. Does this sound like you? If so, Vestiaire Collective encourages you to reconsider your application. We look forward to receiving your application!

Vestiaire Collective is an equal opportunities employer

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Job Title: Machine Learning Engineer




Location: Remote (preferably based in Germany, ideally Berlin)




Salary: €65k - €100k+




Join Europe's Fastest-Growing EdTech Platform!

Are you passionate about the transformative potential of AI in education? We are reimagining education through machine learning and AI, and we need talented engineers like you to help shape the future!




Role Overview:

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will take full ownership of building and optimizing our AI-driven product. You'll work across both backend and AI systems to enhance the learning experience for our users. Collaborating with a dynamic, high-growth team, you'll help define the future of personalized education.




Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and optimize machine learning models to power AI-driven tutors, focusing on improving user experience and key performance metrics.
Lead end-to-end ML development: from model discovery, algorithm development, to testing and production deployment.
Collaborate cross-functionally with product, backend, and frontend teams to integrate AI features into the product.
Drive innovation in machine learning and AI, continuously improving our product's capabilities and performance.




Must-Have Skills:

Strong understanding of machine learning principles and techniques (professional experience is not required, but a solid grasp of fundamentals is necessary).
Experience working on AI projects (academic, personal, or professional) with hands-on model development and experimentation.
Enthusiasm for AI’s potential impact on the education space.
Self-driven, with the ability to work independently in a fast-paced, growing startup environment.
Familiarity with product development processes and understanding how to leverage AI to drive business outcomes.




Nice-to-Have Skills:

Experience with full-stack development (ability to contribute to both backend and frontend code).
Familiarity with key product metrics such as user growth, retention, and engagement.
Knowledge of deploying machine learning models into production environments.




What We Offer:

Equity (ESOP): Share in the company’s success and growth.
Benefits: Access to Urban Sports Club, team-building events, development budgets, and more!
Remote Work: Hybrid model with travel budget for team workations.




We’re looking for engineers who are excited about AI's potential and want to make a real impact on education. Join our journey to build the future!

Title: Data Scientist (f/m/d) Machine Learning Ops
Description:
As a Machine Learning Operation Engineer (ML OPS) you are part of our ED&AA Unit at Siemens Energy and work on challenging projects from all areas of the energy industry. You will transform Machine Learning models to well-engineered products fulfilling development, deployment and monitoring requirements and standards.

Let’s Talk About You!

What You Bring


Hands-on experience with ML frameworks, libraries, agile environments and deploying machine learning solutions using DevOps principles.
Excellent knowledge of data science programming languages (Python, R, Scala).
Excellent knowledge of the boto3 AWS SDK or additional SDKs for other cloud platforms.
Good knowledge of cloud infrastructure.
Excellent knowledge of container technologies (docker, Kubernetes, OpenShift etc.).
Familiar with REST API protocol as well as at least model serving technologies (MLFlow, Seldon Core, Kubeflow, TFX, Sagemaker endpoints etc.).
Excellent knowledge of the ML life-cycle.
Experience in creation of CI/CD pipelines for machine learning projects.



How You Will Make An Impact


Deploy, operationalize and maintain Machine Learning (ML) models with a focus on optimization of model hyperparameters, automated retraining and model training, version control and governance and model monitoring and its drift.
Establish model onboarding, operations, and decommissioning workflows.
Track, snapshot & manage assets used to create the models.
Enable collaboration, sharing and standardization of ML pipelines developed by data scientists.
Maintain model asset integrity & persist access control logs.
Certify model behavior meets regulatory & adversarial standards. You will be heavily supported by data scientists and Subject Matter Experts in this task
Support model portability across a variety of platforms. We do not have cloud-agnostic ML pipelines, but dependencies should be minimal.
Certify model performance meets functional and latency requirements.
Evaluate design patterns for model deployment. Evaluate design patterns for unit testing and integration testing for machine learning products.
Create and maintain scalable ML Ops frameworks to support product-specific models.



Who is Siemens Energy?

At Siemens Energy, we are more than just an energy technology company. We meet the growing energy demand across 90+ countries while ensuring our climate is protected. With ~100,000 dedicated employees, we not only generate electricity for over 16% of the global community, but we’re also using our technology to help protect people and the environment.

Our global team is committed to making sustainable, reliable, and affordable energy a reality by pushing the boundaries of what is possible. We uphold a 150-year legacy of innovation that encourages our search for people who will support our focus on decarbonization, new technologies, and energy transformation.

Find out how you can make a difference at Siemens Energy: https://www.siemens-energy.com/employeevideo

Our Commitment to Diversity

Lucky for us, we are not all the same. Through diversity, we generate power. We run on inclusion and our combined creative energy is fueled by over 130 nationalities. Siemens Energy celebrates character – no matter what ethnic background, gender, age, religion, identity, or disability. We energize society, all of society, and we do not discriminate based on our differences.

Rewards/Benefits


An inclusive team culture where you can be yourself
Opportunities to work on and lead a variety of innovative projects
Enjoy a stable employment in a company with a long history in innovation and technology
Seize individual development and training opportunities, from job specific to soft skills
Welfare: flexible welfare programs and health insurance.



https://jobs.siemens-energy.com/jobs


Show more

Title: Software Engineer
Description:
The SAP Engineering team within Azure Core is a team that has the focus on enabling, helping and supporting SAP to integrate SAP software and services into the Azure platform. Beyond that the team develops solution and reference architectures for SAP workload on the Azure platform. The team is spread globally with two main locations of the SAP headquarter in Walldorf in Germany and the Microsoft headquarter in Redmond, WA.

For further developing integrations of SAP services, we are looking for a software engineer for our development team located in the SAP headquarters in Walldorf/Rot in Germany.

Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.

Responsibilities


Work with different line of business within SAP which deploy and integrate their SaaS and PaaS applications and platforms in Azure using Kubernetes or other open source frameworks
Work on analyzing and investigate deployments, develop solutions and work with the Azure Compute Engineering teams to improve and enhance the experience of SAP hosting and deploying their SaaS and PaaS services on the Azure platform.
Works with appropriate stakeholders to determine user requirements for a set of features.
Contributes to the identification of dependencies, and the development of design documents for a product area with little oversight.
Creates and implements code for a product, service, or feature, reusing code as applicable.
Contributes to efforts to break down larger work items into smaller work items and provides estimation.


Qualifications

Required Qualifications:


Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related technical field AND technical engineering experience with coding in languages including, but not limited to, C, C++, C#, Java, JavaScript, or Python
OR equivalent experience.
Experience with cloud environments, preferably Azure.
Knowledge of authentication methods in cloud native environments, like OAUTH, SAML, MFA, SSO, Entra ID, certificate authorities.

Other Qualifications


Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: 
Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud Background Check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.

Preferred Qualifications


Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science
OR related technical field AND technical engineering experience with coding in languages including, but not limited to, C, C++, C#, Java, JavaScript,
OR Python.
OR Master's Degree in Computer Science or related technical field AND technical engineering experience with coding in languages including, but not limited to, C, C++, C#, Java, JavaScript, or Python
OR equivalent experience.
Experience with monitoring and telemetry in cloud native environments
Experience with deploying landscapes via Terraform and Ansible
Experience in Kubernetes architecture, setup/installation and the operation in production environments
Experience in working with community driven OSS projects driven on GitHub


#azurecorejobs

#MSFTNSBE25

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
AI Engineer

Location: Berlin/Hybrid




We are seeking a talented and driven AI Engineer to join fast-growing AI start-up, REMATIQ. This is an exciting opportunity to work on cutting-edge AI solutions that are transforming regulatory affairs. As a AI Engineer, you will take ownership of designing, building, and scaling machine learning systems that drive impactful innovation in the industry.




Responsibilities

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and deploy machine learning models into production.
Build and optimize scalable and efficient machine learning pipelines for data processing, model training, and deployment.
Lead efforts in identifying, implementing, and validating the best algorithms and techniques for solving business challenges.
Take ownership of model performance, monitoring, and continuous improvement in production.
Mentor junior team members and contribute to fostering a collaborative engineering culture.
Research and stay up-to-date on advancements in machine learning, MLOps, and related technologies.
Contribute to the development of best practices in model lifecycle management, including reproducibility and version control.




Requirements

Proven experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or AI Engineer in a similar role, with expertise in Python.
Strong track record of delivering production-grade machine learning systems, including model deployment and monitoring.
Proficiency in at least one of the following areas:
Data Science: Advanced analytics, statistical modeling, and insights generation.
MLOps: Building robust CI/CD pipelines for machine learning workflows and automation.
Large Language Models (LLMs): Fine-tuning, training, or deploying state-of-the-art transformer-based models.
Natural Language Processing (NLP): Developing applications like text classification, summarization, or entity recognition.
Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) and containerization tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to prioritize tasks effectively in a fast-paced environment.
Familiarity with scalable data storage and processing systems (e.g., Spark, Hadoop, or similar).
Passion for leveraging AI to revolutionize regulatory affairs.




Nice-to-Have Skills

Experience working in an early-stage start-up
Familiarity with regulatory affairs or compliance-related applications.
Contributions to open-source machine learning projects.
Expertise in deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Strong software engineering practices, including code reviews, testing, and documentation.




Why Join Us?

Innovative Mission: Be part of transforming regulatory affairs with cutting-edge AI technology.
Impactful Role: Take ownership of significant projects and contribute to shaping the future of the industry.
Collaborative Environment: Work with a small, ambitious team where everyone has real ownership over the product and company.
Growth Opportunities: Learn and grow in a fast-paced start-up environment with continuous professional development.
Compensation: Competitive salary and a generous equity package for early employees..




Join REMATIQ and be a driving force in revolutionizing regulatory affairs through AI. If you are a passionate and skilled AI Engineer ready to make an impact, we’d love to hear from you!

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Company: SR2 | Socially Responsible Recruitment | Certified B Corporation™
Description:
SR2 are partnered with a global consultancy who are looking for Data Science specialists.




In this role, you will leverage your expertise in data analysis and statistical modeling to help clients uncover trends, patterns, and insights from their data. You will work on projects involving data collection, cleaning, visualization, and interpretation, turning complex datasets into actionable insights that inform business strategy. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, proficiency in programming languages like Python or R, and experience with data visualisation and statistical techniques.




Requirements:

Bachelor’s or Master’s in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proficient in Python and data analysis libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, or scikit-learn.
Familiar with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP.
Experience with Databricks is essential.
Strong problem-solving, critical thinking, and communication skills.




Role

6-12+ month contract with high probability of extension
Hybrid with occasional travel to Munich
Candidates have to be based in Germany
2x Stage interview process




If you're passionate about using data to solve real-world business challenges, we'd love to hear from you.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
About Fit Analytics Innovation GmbH




Fit Analytics Innovation is a leading technology company specializing in innovative and sustainable solutions for the retail industry. Our mission is to revolutionize the online shopping experience by providing personalized recommendations including size and fit, style, and alternative product suggestions. Our technologies support shoppers and retailers alike by reducing returns, increasing conversions, enhancing customer satisfaction, and ultimately helping the environment.




As a trusted partner of leading global apparel and footwear retailers, Fit Analytics is dedicated to optimizing the online shopping journey. By seamlessly integrating our sizing technology, we empower customers to make informed choices, leading to a more efficient and enjoyable shopping experience.




Our cutting-edge AI solution - Fit Finder - delivers precise size recommendations tailored to individual customers. Our machine learning technology takes brand-specific sizing variations and individual body measurements into account, ensuring a personalized and reliable fit for each shopper.




Our team members come from all around the world, creating a global collective of passionate domain experts dedicated to solving sizing for our partners and their shoppers.




Role Overview:

Embark on an exciting journey with Fit Analytics Innovation as a Senior Data Scientist, where you'll play a pivotal role in driving the success of our cutting-edge recommendation solutions. As a seasoned professional, you will contribute to projects in production with your strong ML and SWE skillset. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to pave the way forward with innovative ideas and bring them to life.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop state of the art solutions for apparel sizing, style, and product recommendations.
Experience with implementing the lifecycle of ML solutions
Champion best practices in code quality, review, and software architecture.
Drive continuous innovation in ML techniques and strategies to maintain competitive advantage and keep pace with industry standards.
Collaborate with product and engineering teams to align ML technologies with business goals and enhance customer outcomes.




Requirements and Qualifications:

Proven experience as a Senior Data Scientist, particularly in recommendation systems and scalable ML solutions.
Proficient in Python and SQL.
Extensive experience with ML frameworks and tools such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and ML serving technologies like TensorFlow Serving or NVIDIA Triton.
Proficient in developing and optimizing ML pipelines, model deployment, and serving strategies.
Strong record of software engineering best practices, including testing, data structures, algorithms, and complexity analysis.
Proactive attitude towards organizational growth, personal development and developing team spirit
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to communicate complex ideas effectively with all levels of an organization.

Show more
HTML:
About Fit Analytics Innovation GmbH


Fit Analytics Innovation is a leading technology company specializing in innovative and sustainable solutions for the retail industry. Our mission is to revolutionize the online shopping experience by providing personalized recommendations including size and fit, style, and alternative product suggestions. Our technologies support shoppers and retailers alike by reducing returns, increasing conversions, enhancing customer satisfaction, and ultimately helping the environment.


As a trusted partner of leading global apparel and footwear retailers, Fit Analytics is dedicated to optimizing the online shopping journey. By seamlessly integrating our sizing technology, we empower customers to make informed choices, leading to a more efficient and enjoyable shopping experience.


Our cutting-edge AI solution - Fit Finder - delivers precise size recommendations tailored to individual customers. Our machine learning technology takes brand-specific sizing variations and individual body measurements into account, ensuring a personalized and reliable fit for each shopper.


Our team members come from all around the world, creating a global collective of passionate domain experts dedicated to solving sizing for our partners and their shoppers.


Role Overview:

Embark on an exciting journey with Fit Analytics Innovation as a Senior Data Scientist, where you'll play a pivotal role in driving the success of our cutting-edge recommendation solutions. As a seasoned professional, you will contribute to projects in production with your strong ML and SWE skillset. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to pave the way forward with innovative ideas and bring them to life.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop state of the art solutions for apparel sizing, style, and product recommendations.
  • Experience with implementing the lifecycle of ML solutions
  • Champion best practices in code quality, review, and software architecture.
  • Drive continuous innovation in ML techniques and strategies to maintain competitive advantage and keep pace with industry standards.
  • Collaborate with product and engineering teams to align ML technologies with business goals and enhance customer outcomes.


Requirements and Qualifications:

  • Proven experience as a Senior Data Scientist, particularly in recommendation systems and scalable ML solutions.
  • Proficient in Python and SQL.
  • Extensive experience with ML frameworks and tools such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and ML serving technologies like TensorFlow Serving or NVIDIA Triton.
  • Proficient in developing and optimizing ML pipelines, model deployment, and serving strategies.
  • Strong record of software engineering best practices, including testing, data structures, algorithms, and complexity analysis.
  • Proactive attitude towards organizational growth, personal development and developing team spirit
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to communicate complex ideas effectively with all levels of an organization.

Title: Data Scientist, Traveler Data Products
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, people from all over the world have booked more than 150 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 800 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

At GetYourGuide (GYG), we're looking for a passionate Data Scientist to join our Traveler Data Products Team. In this role, you'll have the opportunity to make a significant impact on our product and our customers' experiences. You'll work with a vast and diverse set of structured and unstructured data, powering various data products such as search, recommendations, SEM, and incentives. Our team has touchpoints across the business, developing end-to-end solutions that directly contribute to creating memorable travel experiences for people around the world.

Join the Traveler Data Products Team, where we are passionate about creating data-driven solutions that empower travelers to discover and connect with the perfect experiences. Our mission is to make our vast inventory accessible and relevant by tailoring it to individual interests, extracting valuable insights from product descriptions, and customizing page layouts to meet our users' unique needs. We are also at the forefront of exploring how Large Language Models (LLMs) can accelerate the discovery of relevant products, ensuring a seamless and enriching customer journey.

As a valued member of our inclusive and dynamic team, you will collaborate closely with fellow Data Scientists and MLOps Engineers, continuously innovating to enhance the relevance and personalization of the products we display. Together, we strive to make every travel experience unforgettable.

You Will


Develop innovative data products that not only delight our customers but also drive the success of our company.
Take full ownership of projects, guiding them from the initial business challenge to the deployment of production code. This includes:
Contribute to the development of our machine learning infrastructure and help establish best practices that will shape our future.
Work closely with cross-functional teams, leveraging your unique perspective to solve complex and exciting problems.
Support the continuous improvement and growth of our team, including participating in recruiting efforts to bring in new talent.


Who You Are

Ideal candidates will have experience in most of the following areas:


Machine Learning Familiarity with regressors, classifiers, and recommender systems. A solid understanding of ML techniques and their practical applications. Experience deploying ML models in production is a plus.
Software Engineering Proficiency in Python. Knowledge of distributed machine learning and computing frameworks (e.g., Spark) is beneficial.
Analytics Ability to transform data into actionable insights. Experience with hypothesis testing and proficiency in analytics tools (e.g., pandas, R) and SQL.
Business Acumen Applied experience in a business environment, demonstrating result-driven work.
Academic Background An advanced degree in a quantitative field or equivalent practical experience.
Communication Strong skills in explaining complex concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.


We value potential and enthusiasm as much as experience. If you are passionate about data science and eager to learn, we encourage you to apply, even if you don't meet all the criteria listed above.

How We Set You Up For Success


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Well-stocked kitchen and team-building events like our famous pizza & beer Fridays
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
Save on transportation costs with discounted public transportation tickets
Support your loved ones with generous maternity and paternity leave policies
Relocation assistance if needed


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: AI / Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Job Description

Are you a passionate AI/ML Engineer looking to make a significant impact in a dynamic and innovative environment? Join our team and be at the forefront of AI-driven transformation!

About The Team

Data is the fuel that keeps our world moving, and we at Natuvion are experts in moving large quantities of it. We are a small team of computer science experts dedicated to accelerating data transformation, making it more efficient, pleasant, and secure. Essentially, we operate as a startup within a well-established company. Our team members hold advanced degrees in computer engineering, logic, physics, and related fields, fostering a culture of deep technical expertise and continuous learning. We pride ourselves on our fast-paced development, strong team culture, and open, focused communication.

Why Join Us?


Innovative Projects: Work on designing and implementing fascinating projects like implementing a programming language in conjunction with cutting-edge AI applications.
Collaborative Environment: Be part of a team that values open communication and collaboration, where your ideas and contributions are highly valued.
Cutting-Edge Technology: Engage with the latest advancements in AI and machine learning, and apply them to real-world problems.
Professional Growth: Benefit from a culture that encourages continuous learning and professional development.



Your Responsibilities


Design, develop, and deploy AI models and algorithms to solve complex problems and enhance our products.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand requirements and deliver AI solutions that meet business needs.
Conduct data preprocessing and feature engineering to prepare data for modeling.
Implement and optimize AI techniques such as semantic search, NLP, and recommendation systems.
Ensure code quality and scalability through the use of typing tools like mypy and pyright.
Generate comprehensive documentation and presentations to communicate findings and solutions.
Analyze current AI scenarios, identify gaps, and discuss implementation possibilities with other engineers and stakeholders.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI and machine learning to continuously improve our solutions.



Job requirements

Core Skills


Deep Learning and Machine Learning: Proficiency in frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn.
Large Language Models (LLMs): Understanding of current models and their applications.
AI Techniques and Applications: Experience with various AI techniques such as semantic search, natural language processing (NLP), and recommendation systems.
Programming Skills: Proficiency in Python, with a strong emphasis on scalable and understandable code using typing tools like mypy and pyright. Familiarity with Haskell is a plus.
Data Preprocessing and Feature Engineering: Expertise in preparing and transforming raw data into suitable formats for modeling.
Documentation and Presentation: Ability to generate comprehensive documentation and presentations.
Collaboration and Communication: Strong interpersonal skills to work effectively within the team and with other stakeholders.
Analyzing AI Scenarios: Ability to analyze the current basis for specific AI scenarios like Automatic Data Analysis, Root Cause Identification, Mapping Rule Generation, and other relevant areas for large scale data transformations. Identify gaps and discuss implementation possibilities with other engineers and stakeholders.



About Our Core Products


DCS (Data Conversion Server): An orchestration engine for designing, executing, and monitoring data transformation workflows within SAP systems.
Compose: A programming language for DCS that enables bidirectional compilation, allowing DCS content to be converted into Compose code and vice versa, facilitating version control, continuous integration, and more.



What You Can Expect From Us

An environment that is always open to change and optimization. There is no such thing as “that's the way it's always been” with us. You have the chance to contribute your knowledge, shape processes, standardize existing topics or optimize workflows. Be a driving force and take us even further with your expertise!

We Create An Environment In Which You Feel Comfortable


Home office contracts
Permanent employment and 30 days' vacation
Trust-based working hours - work in a way that best suits your everyday life and our customers
Mentoring program - a good induction according to your needs for an optimal start with us
#teamgreen - An internal network of experienced experts for mutual exchange and the joint development of solutions to problems
An appreciative employee culture, flat hierarchies, short communication channels and an open-door policy - a team that supports and inspires each other!
Regular team events and workshops on site
With our new health benefit 'Nilo' you get 10 free therapy sessions a year and can use the app for meditations, lessons and courses - all for your well-being!
Further training is a priority



Join #teamgreen - Natuvion is a digital moving company.

Our team doesn't move desks, filing cabinets or chairs. Natuvion moves business-critical data and processes from one technology platform to another. Typical Natuvion “relocation services” include data migration, data transformation, data integration, data protection, data security and data quality.

Our >400 consultants and developers in Germany, Austria, Slovakia, the USA and Australia have extensive expertise in (SAP®) projects and a profound understanding of processes across industry boundaries. With a great deal of experience, commitment and dedication, they support our customers with consulting, services and our own software technology. In this way, we enable companies to use their data and processes on the most modern and innovative platforms at all times.

Join us and be a part of a team that is at the forefront of AI innovation, driving transformation and delivering value to our clients and partners. If you are passionate about AI and eager to make an impact, we would love to hear from you
